metadata.notes: Unified evidence + source tracking. Combines sources, evidence log, and forecast registry into one file.

forecasts.statement: At least one Tesla production vehicle delivered to U.S. customers includes an A15-class compute module by 2027-03-31.
kill_criteria: By 2026-12-31: no credible teardowns, FCC filings, or primary-source references to new compute module entering builds → reduce to ≤0.25
what_changes_my_mind: FCC filing for new Tesla compute module
Teardown of pre-production vehicle with new board
Credible supplier leak tied to specific foundry node + timeline
key_assumptions: HW4→A15 transition follows similar timeline pattern to HW3→HW4

forecasts.statement: A15-class compute is available in the U.S. configurator on at least one high-volume Tesla model (Model Y/3) by 2027-03-31.
kill_criteria: Q1 kill criteria fires → Q2 automatically reduces to ≤0.15
Tesla announces A15 as Cybertruck/Semi-only through 2027 → reduce to ≤0.20
what_changes_my_mind: Tesla configurator update showing new compute option on Model Y/3
Credible reporting on production line retooling for Model Y/3 at Fremont or Austin
key_assumptions: Tesla prioritizes high-volume models for new compute (not guaranteed — could start with Cybertruck or new model)

forecasts.statement: A15-class compute reaches meaningful volume (>=30% of U.S. deliveries across models) by 2027-03-31.
kill_criteria: Q1 kill criteria fires → Q3 automatically reduces to ≤0.05
Credible reporting shifts volume 2027 to late 2027/2028 → reduce to ≤0.10
what_changes_my_mind: Tesla earnings guidance indicating new compute across lineup
key_assumptions: 30% volume within months of first delivery is historically rare for Tesla HW transitions

forecasts.statement: Noticeable reduction in driver interventions on LA-area freeways (clear weather, light-to-moderate traffic) vs early-2026 baselines by 2027-03-31. Defined as >=30% reduction where measurable, OR consensus among >=3 credible independent testers.
kill_criteria: Multiple independent testers report regression or plateau in FSD v13+ → reduce by 0.10-0.15
Tesla shifts engineering resources away from FSD (unlikely but possible) → reduce sharply
what_changes_my_mind: FSD v13/v14 release notes showing specific highway improvements
Independent tester longitudinal data showing measurable improvement
Tesla publishing disengagement metrics (extremely unlikely but would be Grade A)
key_assumptions: Early-2026 baselines can be estimated from community tester data
Highway performance is less hardware-gated than surface street performance

forecasts.statement: Noticeable reduction in driver interventions on LA-area surface streets (arterials + unprotected turns) vs early-2026 baselines by 2027-03-31. Defined as >=20% reduction where measurable, OR consensus among >=3 credible independent testers.
kill_criteria: Multiple independent testers report no improvement in surface street handling → reduce to ≤0.25
Regulatory action restricts surface street FSD use → reframe question
what_changes_my_mind: Release notes targeting unprotected turns, pedestrian handling, or parking lot navigation
Tester consensus on surface street improvement
A15 hardware enabling higher-resolution perception that specifically helps urban scenarios
key_assumptions: Surface streets are harder than highways; improvement rate is historically slower
Unprotected left turns remain the primary challenge in urban FSD

forecasts.statement: Regulatory pressure results in additional guardrails or constraints that noticeably reduce risky/non-compliant behaviors (rolling stops, late aggressive merges, etc.) by 2027-03-31.
kill_criteria: NHTSA closes active investigations without action → reduce by 0.15-0.20
New administration signals deregulatory stance toward AV → reduce by 0.10
what_changes_my_mind: New NHTSA enforcement action or recall specific to FSD behaviors
CA DMV regulatory changes affecting FSD testing/deployment
IIHS rating downgrade tied to specific behavioral issues
key_assumptions: Current regulatory trajectory continues (active investigations, increasing scrutiny)
Political environment could shift this significantly in either direction

forecasts.statement: By 2026-12-31, decisive public evidence exists that A15 is (or is not) the same generation as AI5/HW5.
kill_criteria: By 2026-09-30 no teardowns or filings reference any of these names → reduce to 0.50
what_changes_my_mind: Tesla official documentation using consistent naming
Teardown identifying board markings with clear generation labels
FCC filing with model number cross-referenced to known naming
key_assumptions: Tesla naming typically becomes clear through teardowns/FCC filings 6-12 months before volume
